name: purism
content:

the fact of believing in and following very traditional rules or ideas in a subject: The school had an emphasis on modernism and purism in design. He has made a lifelong pursuit of purism in music. See
purist
More examplesFewer examplesDylan chafed at the folk movement's ideological purism.Her style flattens everything in the interest of geometric and linear purism. He was steeped in the strict purism of the modernist school of architecture.
